dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “1981” Two eager and anxious 10-year-olds make their way up the to the front steps. Meet skinny CHARLIE KAGAN, and his be friend, the portly STU KLAMINSKY. They each carry gifts. Charlie’s present is meticulously wrapped with bow and ribbon... Stu’s is cobbled together newspaper and duct tape. sTU (excited) Seven minutes in heaven! What could be better than seven minutes in heaven?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Eight minutes in heaven? (off Stu’s look) What? sTU Try not to embarrass me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE

dialogues.text: Or thumb.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I should have written this down. (head spinning) Boob, finger, thumb... so, what the heck is first base?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So I’ve gone to first base with my Mom?

dialogues.speaker: STU

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE

Rain delay is when grown-ups interrupt you in the middle of your game. And an inside the park home run is a blowjob. They arrive on the doorstep.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (without missing a beat as he rings the bell) I have no idea. But I overheard my dad saying that he gets one once a year on his birthday so it must be good. BRITTA COOKSEY, a prepubescent peach, opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: BRITTA

A she and Stu walk toward the closet, we catch Charlie eyei the birthday girl in rhapsody. He awkwardly smiles at her. We RACK-FOCUS to discover another little girl catching the look. She’s a GOTH GIRL outcast and hasn’t taken her eyes off Charlie all evening She just STARES while fingering a Wicca-style pentagram necklace that hangs around her neck. It’s a little creepy A couple of the school-kids snicker and LOCK Stu and Jenn inside the closet.

dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A BOTTLE -- a little hand comes into frame and g it. PULL BACK to REVEAL that it’s Charlie’s turn to spin. He looks around the circle, zeroing in on Britta.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (swooning) The birthday girl. sTU You take wind speed into account? Charlie glances up to see the spinning ceiling fan. He no

dialogues.text: Blowjob. I/’11 tell you about it later. The boys head back to the circle and Charlie carefully SP THE BOTTLE. It turns. And turns. And turns. Slowing as it reaches Britta Cooksey. Yes. Closer. Closer. Nooooooooo!!!!! It just misses her and spins past. And POINTS DIRECTLY at the GOTH GIRL. Charlie smiles uncomfortably. She just STARES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the terrifying CLICK of the DOOR LOCKING behind t as Bauhaus’ “Bela Lugosi’s Dead” plays. The Goth Girl stares at Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Stop staring. You’re freaking me out.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That's okay. I’m kind of... new at this. (awkward shrug) Rookie. (awkward beat) That’s a baseball term.

dialogues.speaker: GOTH GIRL
dialogues.text: (abrupt) Let me see your penis. Charlie starts to stumble back as Goth Girl approaches. GOTH GIRL (cont'd) What’s the matter? Don’t you want me? She PULLS OFF HER SHIRT, revealing a LEATHER TRAINING BRA

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (loudly) Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the door, the kids listen with amusement.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: That was quick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goth Girl is all over him now. Kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I can’t breathe. He pushes her off. BLACK LIPSTICK SMEARED ALL OVER HIS FA

dialogues.speaker: GOTH GIRL
dialogues.text: I love you, Charlie. I’ve loved you since third grade.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You’re scaring me. Charlie stumbles back. Pulling himself up on clothes hang in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE

dialogues.text: I read in my Mom’s Cosmo... this is supposed to increase pleasure... She pounces, her FINGERNAILS scrape down his chest. He SCREAMS in pain, trying to crawl from under her. GOTH GIRL (cont'd) Don’t worry, this is my first time, too.

dialogues.speaker: GOTH GIRL
dialogues.text: No, silly. Making love. Now relax. She awkwardly TWISTS HIS NIPPLES. Charlie screams.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Ow! You freak!! He bucks her off him and RUNS at the closet door, BREAKIN THROUGH THE SHUTTERED PANELS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie falls to the ground, surrounded by kids looking o shocked amusement. The Goth Girl steps out and angrily glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: GOTH GIRL
dialogues.text: Charlie Kagan, you are not my boyfriend anymore.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: We interrupt this news report to bring you the following information -- no duhi Goth Girl stands above Charlie, who struggles to stand.

dialogues.speaker: GOTH GIRL
dialogues.text: I hex you!

dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: GOTH GIRL

dialogues.speaker: GOTH GIRL
dialogues.text: (possessed) Around you love will fall like rain, but you shan't hold it - your heart will pain. Once the girl has been with you, to the next she will be true.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Is that Phil Collins? Charlie is finally standing, but Goth Girl PUSHES HIM BAC INTO THE CLOSET AGAIN AND EXITS. STORAGE BOXES rain on top of Charlie. Stu rushes into the closet and looks down at the still-terrified Charlie.  STU (cont'd) What happened? Did you thumb her? off Charlie’s scarred-for-life look, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ocean water shimmers in the moonlight. Two lovers kis passionately by the shore. SUPER: “Present” REVEAL CHARLIE (now 30s) and CAROL, his current girlfrien Charlie has a boyish charm and an infectious grin. He’s t kind of friend who would donate his liver so you could ha another drink. Charlie pulls up for air.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You're amazing.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (mischievous ) Now, Charlie... are you just trying to get me into bed?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Forget bed. I’m trying to get you into sand. She leans back and pulls him down onto the wet beach. Clothes are torn off. Both are completely naked. It’s the NC-17 version of “From Here to Eternity”. CHARLIE (cont’d) Um... this is a public beach. Carol disappears below frame. Charlie moans. CHARLIE (cont’d) Oh, my God... Carol.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I love you. Charlie is silent. She repeats it, in case he didn’t hear CAROL (cont'd) I love you.  Charlie doesn’t respond. Carol surfaces. CAROL (cont'd) I love you, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That's... nice.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: That's “nice”?! I’m licking sand off your balls and you say, “that’s nice”?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No, I said “Oh, my God” about that. Believe me, it was a very enthusiastic “Oh, my God”. Carol stands up and grabs her clothes. CHARLIE (cont’d) I love... that you love me.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: That’s pathetic. Carol starts to walk away. Charlie covers his groin with shirt and chases her down the beach.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Wait, I feel very strongly for you. She keeps walking, faster now. He stumbles behind. CHARLIE (cont'd) I’m sorry, I just don’t think the “L” word should be thrown around casually, that’s all.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: The “L” word. What are you, eight?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: “Love.” Okay, “love.” It shouldn’t be bandied about.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: How about the “F” word? And the “U" word? Without looking back, she walks away down the beach.  10 11 10. Defeated, Charlie walks back to the spot where they undressed. He looks for his pants -- but they have WASHED AWAY in th waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soaking wet Charlie, still holding his shirt over himse approaches his car in the empty parking lot. LOCKED! Damn. As he plays with the door, a SIREN WHIRS and LIGHTS FLASH police car stops in front of him. A BUTCH FEMALE POLICE OFFICER gets out of the car and calls to him over the loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (LOUDSPEAKER)
dialogues.text: Put your hands up where I can see them. Charlie awkwardly starts to raise his hands (and the shir covering himself). POLICE OFFICER (lOUDSPEAKER) (cont'd) Down! Put your hands back down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and STU (now 30s) grab drinks from a coffee cart the pharmacy of Charlie’s building. Stu has become a plastic surgeon. He was a nerd as a kid, and success has now made Stu a nerd with too much money. He has a little dried blood on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You going to Katie’s wedding next week?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Do bridesmaids give head in the coat room? Do you know how easy it is to score at a wedding?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Have you ever scored at a wedding?  11. sTU (defensive) I’m pacing myself. (then) Hey, is it weird that you were dating Katie six months ago and now she’s marrying a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'ma doctor. sTU He’s a heart surgeon; you’re a dentist. It’s like saying General Patton and Colonel Mustard are both military men.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'm thinking that this might be the last conversation we ever have. So if there’s anything you want to tell me, now is definitely the time.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Your mother sucks a mean cock. (without missing a beat) You going to the wedding with Carol?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Nah. We broke up three weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I did. Three times.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: She was so into you, man.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just-- I don’t know what’s wrong with me. I want love. I want to fall in love, but...

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Chuck, love is not a four letter word.  12 12.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Actually, it is. (changing the subject; re: Stu’s clothes) Why are you always spackled in blood?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Hey, breast reconstruction is a messy job. THEY STEP INTO THE ELEVATOR to head up to their offices.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (thoughtful) Does seeing breasts every day... you know...

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: That's disgusting. I’1l have you know that I’m a professional. A beat. Then, unable to hold it, STU LAUGHS LOUDLY. The doors close on him laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out of the elevator and move to their separate offices. Stu’s sign reads: “DR. STUART KLAMINSKY -- RECONSTRUCTIVE SURGERY”. Charlie’s reads: “DR. CHARLES KAGAN; DDS”. The two best friends are literally across th hallway from each other. A GIGANTICALLY BUXOM BLONDE approaches Stu’s office.

dialogues.speaker: BUXOM BLONDE
dialogues.text: Hi, Dr. Stu. She disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (sly whisper) I’ve jerked off to her X-rays.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I hope you find the time to write to me from Hell. Just then, a LARGE BLACK WOMAN (imagine if Queen Latifah Oprah) opens Charlie’s door from the inside. This is REBA his office manager/secretary.  13 13.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: Dr. Charlie, you’re five minutes late. You’ve got four fillings, three cleanings, two crowns, and a canal. You've got too many patients and I’ve got too little patience for you to be gabbing gossip with Dr. Boobjobs in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Hi, Reba, nice to see you. Reba doesn’t acknowledge him. She starts back in, but suddenly spins on Stu.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: Were you just looking at my tits?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: What? No.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: Because I am more than happy with what the Lord Almighty gave me. And if you don’t want me to squash you like the bug that you are-- sTU (actually scared) I promise. I wasn’t looking at-- Reba holds up a finger, silencing him. Temporarily satisfied, she walks back in the office, dragging Charlie back inside with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie washes his hands as his DENTAL INTERN hovers over beautiful patient, TRACEY, with the suction.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE

We want saliva, not her spleen. Charlie smiles warmly down at Tracey and takes over.  14 14. CHARLIE (cont’d) So, you lost a cap?

dialogues.speaker: TRACEY
dialogues.text: Chewing ice. (boldly flirty) My shrink says I have an oral fixation.

dialogues.text: (amiably evasive) My shrink says I need to stop dating my patients.

dialogues.speaker: TRACEY
dialogues.text: Sounds like we both need to fire our shrinks. off her suggestive smile, we...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TRACEY’S APARTMENT - MORNING 14 Charlie and Tracey are in the throws of a sweaty and deafening love-making session. She is yelling so loudly t it’s becoming embarrassing. Charlie tries to inconspicuou cover his ears with his pillow. A car alarm goes off outs Finally, the locomotive reaches the station and the two a silent in bed for a few moments.

dialogues.text: My ears are ringing. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t realize that they were such big fans. Well, I hope we last longer than I did with them.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Wow... I must really suck.

dialogues.speaker: TRACEY
dialogues.text: No, you were good. Really.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Is that why you faked it?

dialogues.speaker: TRACEY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Force of habit. Unlucky in love, I guess. (off his doe-eyed face) You want to give it another shot? Charlie, still taken aback, offers up a dispirited shrug. She kisses and gently snuggles into him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So... how are the girls?

dialogues.speaker: TRACEY
dialogues.text: Married.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Both of them? (she nods) I dated Penny like last year.

dialogues.speaker: TRACEY

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Jeez, feels like everybody is getting married. (suddenly panicked) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 16. CHARLIE (cont'd) You’re still my date for the wedding, aren’t you? I really don’t want to show up at my old girlfriend's wedding flying solo.

dialogues.speaker: TRACEY
dialogues.text: (playful nod) But only because I broke your heart. He smiles, partially placated.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (trying to gain face) I think it’s only fair to let you know... I faked it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reception is in full swing. Drinking, dancing, eating An EIGHTY-YEAR-OLD WOMAN finishes off a gut-wrenchingly horrific rendition of “Oops, I Did it Again” before the cheesy D.J. cuts her off. D.Jd. Thank you, Grandma Loretta. Up next we have Uncle Murray singing “Darling Nikki”. Yes... it is a KARAOKE WEDDING -- God help us all! In the far corner (furthest from the speakers), Stu hover next to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Listen, you’re my wing-man. If the blonde asks, I’m a multi- billionaire who invented ketchup. If it’s the redhead, I wrote “We Are the World”. And if it’s that cheerleader hottie, my penis is in the Guinness Book of World Records. Girth, not length... I want it to sound believable. Charlie nods without listening. He’s too busy watching Tracey chat it up with the BEST MAN. A BEAUTY in a bridesmaid dress walks by. Stu smiles. STU (cont’d) Batter up!  17. He follows her off, as the bride, KATIE, sidles up next t Charlie. She kisses him on the cheek as Uncle Murray grinds the stage floor.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You look great.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: So do you. (looking around) Seeing anyone? Charlie points toward Tracey in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We're getting serious. Katie looks over just as Tracey inhales the Best Man’s tongue. CHARLIE (cont’d) (backpedaling) And at the same time, we try to give each other our space. Katie looks at Charlie, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I worry about you sometimes, Chuck. Always a bridesmaid, never a bride.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It's probably best. White makes my calves look thick.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: (touching his hand) Joke all you want. “The door to the human heart can only be opened from the inside.” (off his look) Dorky, definitely. But also true.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: How about “It’s better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.”

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I’1l buy that when you can honestly told me that you have loved.  16 18.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (nods ) Touche’.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I just want to see you happy, Chuckles. ON STAGE -- Uncle Murray throws out his hip. As he’s help off the stage, the D.J. amps up the crowd. D.d. Attention Hot Mamas! If we could have all the single ladies out on the dance floor for the tossing of the bride’s bouquet. Charlie watches on, amused. He notices that his Tracey is still in the far corner, flirting with the Best Man. He looks a little hurt. A DRUM-ROLL starts as Katie teases all the single ladies the bouquet. D.J. (cont’d) And the next lucky lady is... Katie throws the bouquet high in the air. A few of kids jump for them -- the flailing hands KNOCKIN THE FLOWERS BACK INTO THE AIR. The bouquet flies up and h a revolving fan in the ceiling, shooting the bundle DIREC INTO THE HANDS OF TRACEY. Surprised, she holds them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party has calmed and dinner is almost digested. Charl sits at a table with several PRETTY, SINGLE GIRLS. A coup of chairs are vacant -- including the one for his date, w is nowhere to be found. ON STAGE -- an eight-year-old FLOWER GIRL sings “Brick Ho in the key of “Q”. Charlie and one of the women are in mid-conversation.

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: I’d rather have a twelve-hour colonoscopy than get my teeth cleaned. I hate dentists.  19. Charlie attempts his best friendly smile. At the other en of the room (and not a minute too soon), there is a CLINK GLASS -- all eyes look to the head table. Katie STANDS and addresses her friends and family.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I just want to thank everybody for coming to share this day with us. (looking to her husband) Hans, you make my heart soar. I couldn’t imagine being happier than I am right now. A GROOMSMAN calls out from the table...

dialogues.speaker: GROOMSMAN
dialogues.text: Wait till tonight, sweetheart. The crowd chuckles. Katie raises her glass.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I know it’s a little unorthodox but I'd also like to propose a toast. To Charlie Kagan. Charlie is surprised to hear his name called. Katie winks him. KATIE (cont’d) Thank you, Charlie, for being my lucky charm. There is a confused smattering of applause as everyone drinks: “To Charlie”. Charlie doesn’t drink, trying to figure out what the hell she’s talking about. One of the girls at his table looks him with interest.

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: You’re that Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: (covering) That Charlie that’s a... dentist. Charlie gives her a “huh” look. WE SEE Pretty Girl #2 whispering to #3. In response, she CHORTLES out loud.  20.

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah, right! What-ever. Charlie gives them all a look -- something is weird. SUDDENLY, directly behind Charlie, A BUSBOY and A GUEST collide. CRASH! A flying wine bottle almost decapitates him. Charlie looks up to find CAMERON WEXLER -- perky, cute an klutz in the most adorable sense. She now wears a fair amount of RED WINE on her WHITE JACKET.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (without missing a beat) Table five? Charlie nods and offers her his napkin to dry her jacket. Cameron embarrassingly mouths “thank you” and sits. CAMERON (cont'd) (to Charlie; touch of irony) So, did I miss anything? As she hears the answer, she busies herself by crossing o the “ERON” on her table name card.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Let’s see: to have and to hold, love, respect, I do, I do, you may kiss the bride, chicken or fish, the first dance to a rendition of “I Will Always Love You” that was just plain wrong, white cake, raspberry filling, champagne, and... that’s about it. Cam turns and accidentally knocks her fork on the floor. picks it up and blows on it, dusting it off. The Karaoke kicks in again making it almost impossible to hear the rest of the table. But they don’t seem to mind.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I’m Cam. I went to college with the bride.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Charlie. Used to date the bride.  21.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Me, too. (the table blanches) Well, it was a one-time only experimental thing in college. And the experiment went horribly awry. (a sip of champagne) We couldn't stop giggling. Cam looks Charlie over. CAM (cont ’d) You're not really her type.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I was thinking the same about you.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Oh, the lesbian thing didn’t take. Now I only giggle with boys. (then) You gonna eat that? Charlie shakes his head and pushes his untouched piece of wedding cake toward her.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So, who are you here with?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: No one. (mock offense) What are you trying to say?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Please, my date went home with the best man. (off her look) What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I run the penguin habitat at Sea World.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: No. I’m a serial killer and my M.O. is that I kill people with my kung-fu grip. (off Charlie’s smile) What do you do?  22.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Dentist. Not quite as intriguing as “serial killer”. He deftly slides her his card.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (off the card) Well, at least you get these. We homicidal maniacs don’t usually carry business cards. She finishes off the last bite of his cake, then reaches Tracey’s uneaten slice. As she leans over, she accidental DUMPS a LARGE BOWL OF WATER FILLED WITH FLOATING CANDLES Charlie's lap. He JUMPS BACK, in PAIN from the liquid wax

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (jumping around) Ahhh. Hot. Cold. Hot. Cold.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I am SO sorry. Thoroughly embarrassed, Cam helps Charlie clean up the me They both sit down -- Charlie squishing into his chair. Awkward moment. A little smile comes over Cam’s face. CAM (cont ‘d) The way you just reacted to that... it totally reminded me of someone. (searching her mind) I can’t place it. It’s right there on the tip of my tongue. (then) Oh, yeah, now I remember... (off his skeptical look) -..a six-year-old girl. Charlie nods a “thank you”, taking the dig like a man. St walks right over to Cam, cockily grinning from ear to ear

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Well, here I am... what are your other two wishes?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (awkward aside) Um... If you hadn’t noticed, I was in the middle of flirting with Ms. Wexler.  23. sTU If you hadn’t noticed, she dumped a centerpiece in your lap. Take the hint. (turning to Cam) Hi, I’m Dr. Stuart Klaminsky. But you can call me Dr. Stu. (seeing her wine stain) You know, club soda and salt will get that out. Charlie continues the introduction...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Cam, Stu. Stu, Cam. (to Cam) Stu knows about stains because he’s always covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You a serial killer, too? sTU Reconstructive surgeon. (false modesty) If someone has an accident or was born with a deformity, I’m there to help.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And by deformity, he means “small breasts”.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (to Cam) He’s jealous because he cleans plaque all day while I’m making the world a better place.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Because God knows, what this world needs is another stripper with boobs bigger than her head. (turning to Cam) Would you like to dance?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (teasing; re: Stu) It looks like your dance card is already full.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Maybe later?  17 18 24.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Sorry. It was nice meeting you... both. Cam waves to a good-looking man at another table and make quick exit. Charlie turns on Stu with a “what the hell is wrong with you” look. But he ignores it, looking up at th other women at the table.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Hey, are you ladies familiar with the Guinness Book of World Records? The cheesy KARAOKE SONG being sung on stage cross-—dissol into a cheesy elevator MUSAK rendition, as we... Cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie strides into work. As he ENTERS his lobby, he see dozen or so women waiting. UPON CLOSER INSPECTION he notices that two of them are fr his wedding table. What the hell?!?

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: Good morning, Doctor. I think I have a cavity. Pretty Girl #2 shrugs, “Me, too.” As he walks slowly toward his office, we see that many mo of the women are vaguely familiar -- most were guests at wedding. INT. STU’S OFFICE - LATER 18 Charlie enters Stu’s waiting room and approaches the desk

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hi, Sharon. I need to see Stu right away! FROM THE BACK, we hear Stu...

dialogues.speaker: STU, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo, Chuck. Come back here for a sec.  19 20 25. Charlie heads toward the examination room. As we follow h we see a quick glimpse of MICKEY ROURKE in the waiting ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie walks into a room with Stu and a TOPLESS BLONDE W GIGANTIC FAKE BREASTS. Charlie starts to step out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I... sTU Wait-wait. We need you. Charlie, this is Pleasure. Charlie tries to avert his eyes while shaking her hand.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: PLEASURE
dialogues.text: The pleasure’s all mine. (then) Get it? The “pleasure” is all mine. My name is Pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (lost for words) It’s very... clever.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: We're looking for a second opinion. What do you think? Are they even? Embarrassed, Charlie looks over at the mammoth mammaries. They are obscenely large... but even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk-and-talk through the streets of San Diego’s historic Light District. Stu and Charlie munch on hot-dogs.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (confused) So you knew they were even?  26. sTU Of course they were even -- I did ‘em. I just wanted you to see ‘em without buying a lap dance.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: How did you get a license to practice medicine?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (playing along) “License”? What do you mean? You need a license? Charlie moves toward Stu conspiratorially.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Listen... Have you noticed anything different about me?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Other than your aversion to women’s breasts?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t have a... No, I just... women seem to be coming onto me... in an unusual way.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Well, somebody’s had a full cup of himself today. Stu looks over Charlie’s shoulder to see CAROL STANDING I SHOP, WEARING A WEDDING GOWN! She sees the gawking twosom and steps outside to greet them. She looks much happier than she did while she was ditchin Charlie on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Charlie. Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Carol?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (re: wedding dress) Are those back in season again? Carol holds out her hand to display a MASSIVE ENGAGEMENT RING. Charlie stares at Carol, confused.  21 27.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You're getting married? (she nods) We broke up like a month ago.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: His name is Renaldo. We just clicked. What can I say? (she smiles at him) I guess you are a lucky charm. We go CLOSE ON Charlie as he gets a look of confusion... INT. CHARLIE’S PACIFIC BEACH HOUSE - EVENING 21 Charlie walks in the door from work, throws his white coa over a chair and walks to his answering machine. He presses the button.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER ANSWERING MACHINE
dialogues.text: You have fourteen new messages. (then) Message one...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (ON MACHINE)
dialogues.text: Hey Charlie, my name is Randi Berenfeld. You don’t know me, but I got your number from Amy in Radiology. I was wondering if we could meet for drinks one of these nights. Charlie presses the button, skipping ahead. WOMAN’S VOICE (ON MACHINE) (cont'd) Hi Charlie, my name is Sheila. I was wondering if you were free... (presses button again) Hello Charlie, this is Gwen. (presses button again) Hi. It’s Sarah. (again) Hi, my name is Diane... Charlie hits PAUSE on the machine and sits, stunned.  22 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- a bucket of fish. Cam, dressed in sweats and water-proof boots, dumps the bucket into a tank of swimmi PENGUINS. There are literally hundreds of them; playing, waddling, skidding down a slide into the water. She picks up another pail and scatters it to the straggle

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (to a penguin) Hey, Grumpy. Stop that. Leave Jester alone. She throws a dead fish for Jester in the back. Cam reache for another bucket -- but there is none. CAM (cont ‘d) (calling out) Joe?! Shift it into high gear, will ya? I want to go home. JOE appears, carrying two buckets of fish. Meet Cam’s sullen, lethargic little brother. He looks to be moving i slow motion. A professional pothead, Joe is always one to behind any conversation. He wears a T-shirt with WOODY HARRELSON on the front. CAM (cont‘d) Did you get lost back there?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Smoke break.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You know if they catch you with weed, you’re gonna get fired. It doesn’t matter that you’re my brother.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Re-lax. How is anybody gonna know?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Maybe the hemp pants? Or the hemp shirt? Or the fact that you smell like you showered in bong water? Joe holds out the buckets of herring for her.  23 pt 29.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (reminiscent) When I was in college, I made a bong out of a dried blow-fish.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You never went to college.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Well, I never enrolled. But I sold a ton of shit at Stanford. Cam playfully throws a fish at him and finishes dumping t last bucket into the water. As she turns, she accidentall trips on the SECOND BUCKET. Cam TUMBLES on the top of the PENGUIN SLIDE and starts to SLIP DOWN the chute -- arms flapping, holding fish. She saves herself at the last moment, standing on the edge of ice. Whew!!! JOE (cont‘d) (chortling) And you think I look wasted? At the top of the slide, Cam looks up to see a Penguin ey the fish in her hands. Her smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Wait, Grumpy, no... Too late -- Grumpy dives down the slide and BOWLING BALLS into Cam. Her feet flip out from under her and she does a FACE PLANT against the rock and SINKS INTO THE WATER. The accident is half-tragic/half-hysterical. Joe rushes ( fast as a stoned stoner can rush) to the edge of the wate

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Whoa, Murphy, that was radical. Cam surfaces holding her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I think I chipped a tooth. INT. CHARLIE’S CLASSIC CONVERTIBLE T-BIRD - NIGHT 23 pt The car door opens and a pretty young thing named NICOLE down in the passenger seat demurely. She dolls herself up Charlie walks around the car. The TOP IS DOWN.  30. The driver’s side door opens and Charlie SITS. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Do these seats go down?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Pardon? But she’s not waiting. She pounces, climbing over the sti shift and on top of him. Her butt accidentally JAMS INTO

dialogues.speaker: HORN
dialogues.text: She starts to take off her top. CHARLIE (cont’d) Wait. Don’t you want to...

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: (removing her bra) What?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know... have dinner first?

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Is that how it works? Charlie gently pulls away, looking into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: How what works?

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: You know, the thing. (off Charlie’s blank look) The thing, the magic, the charm, the spell. She immediately attacks him again. The front seat is tiny Her foot brushes the windshield wiper and FLUID SPRAYS OV THE WINDOW, DOUSING THEM. OUTSIDE THE CAR -- we watch as the HEADLIGHTS FLASH ON SEVERAL TIMES from the flailing body parts. Suddenly, the car STARTS TO ROLL DOWN THE HILL AND ONTO A NEIGHBORS’ YA INSIDE THE CAR -- Charlie pulls up the emergency brake an pulls off the girl.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Whoah, whoah, whoah, slow down -- what the hell are you talking about?  A beat. 31.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: (thinking he knows) You’re a lucky charm. You have sex with somebody and then they find their true love. Isn’t that how it works?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Has everybody completely lost their minds? That’s ridiculous. That’s absurd.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Do you want top or bottom?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Wait. I really don’t want to take advantage of you.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Look, don’t take it so seriously. I'm certainly not. I’m doing this on a lark. (then) And you won’t be taking advantage of me. Do you know how many loser boyfriends I’ve had? Do you know how many times I’ve given myself -- body, mind and soul -- hoping that this was the one, this was it, this was my soulmate, only to find that he was just some jerk-off asshole who was more interested in sleeping with my best friend and ready to dump me because he “can’t see daylight between my thighs”. (then; excited) If there’s a chance, even a point-— zero-zero-zero-zero-one percent chance that you’re the key, that being with you might open the door to something better -- well, I think I'd be taking advantage of you.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Would you like to have sex before or after dinner?

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Why don’t we work up an appetite?  32. Boul-ya! They start to kiss passionately when Charlie’s phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. That’s the emergency line. He flips the phone open... CHARLIE (cont’d) (into phone) Dr. Kagan speaking. CAM’S VOICE (on phone) Hi. Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Speaking. 23 pt INTERCUT CHARLIE AND (A STILL SOAKING WET) CAM -- 2

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: This is Cam Wexler. We met a while ago at Katie’s wedding. (a beat; reminding) Serial killer?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (warmly) Of course. Hi. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry to do this to you, but I have a bit of a dental emergency.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (kind; but playful) You know, you don’t have to make up stories, Cam. If you want to see me, you can just ask. Charlie mouths “Sorry” to Nicole, who waits patiently.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: No, I chipped a tooth. It’s Saturday night and I’m in a lot of pain and I didn’t know who else to call.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Chipped a tooth? How?  24 33.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: If you must know, I stepped in a bucket of fish, slid down an ice ramp, got body-slammed by a penguin and fell face first into a fake ice boulder.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: If I had a nickel for every time I've heard that one.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Hello... Hippocratic oath... I’m bleeding. A lot.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (mouthing sorry to Nicole) Do you know where my offices are? Cam looks down at Charlie’s business card in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m leaving now. Cam hangs up the phone and looks over through the glass a Joe, who is now sitting in the room and tripping penguins they waddle by. Each time one falls into the water, he laughs his ass off. Cam shakes her head, incredulously. INT. CHARLIE’S OFFICE - HALF HOUR LATER 24 Cam is on her back in the dental chair. Charlie works ins her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Does that hurt? Cam wiggle-shakes her head and grunts. He keeps working. CHARLIE (cont’d) Wow... that’s some halitosis.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (slurred; mouth open) -evy -unny. -at’s the -ish. Charlie playfully nods “sure it is”.  34.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Fish, huh? (finishing up) You can rinse. Cam leans over, swishes and discreetly spits. She looks u on the wall in front of her. CAM’S P.O.V. -- A photograph of Charlie surrounded by doz of South American children. He stands at the center -- al of them are smiling and holding up toothbrushes. CHARLIE (cont’d) (explaining) I travel to Guatemala once a year to help out in some of the poorer villages. Cam looks him over for a moment: she approves. She moves get up out of the chair and KNOCKS the suction device to floor. Oops. Leaning over to pick it up, her hand comes CRASHING DOWN on the tray of dental tools, which go FLYIN ACROSS THE ROOM. Two of the SHARP METAL PICKS stab Charli in the back, lodging there. CHARLIE (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Charlie reaches around but can’t get them. Cam rushes ove and pulls the instruments out of his back. He gasps. CAM (cont ‘d) Here. I’m so sorry. She starts picking up instruments from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It's okay... I got it. Stop helping before I lose an eye. Charlie takes off his bloodied lab coat and rubs his back

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I hope you’1ll let me have that dry- cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No, but I hope you'll let me take you for dinner on Thursday night. (she looks hesitant) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE (cont'd) Trust me, you’ll be able to do far more damage to me with a steak knife.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I can’t. How much do I owe you for the tooth?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (a little offended) So you draw first blood, but won't make it up to me?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: No really-- how much do I owe you?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Your money is no good here.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Okay. Thank you. An awkward moment. Cam walks out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, dried blood spots on his shirt, is locking up hi office as Cam steps back into the hallway from the elevat He turns to her, happy.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Change your mind?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: My car won't start.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sure it won’t.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I left my lights on. He just looks at her with a grin, not buying it. She roll her eyes and immediately turns back. CAM (cont ‘d) Okay, I’m pushing it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Wait, wait. I want to jump you.  26 27 pt 36. She looks at him -- smiles. He joins her at the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cars are bumper to bumper. Cam sits at her wheel. Charlie attaches jumper cables.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Let her rip. Cam turns the ignition and the car starts right up. While Charlie disconnects the cables, Cam gets out of her (engine running).

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you for fixing my tooth. Thank you for jumping my car.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Don’t mention it. Behind her, her car door CLOSES. She is LOCKED OUT OF HER IDLING CAR.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (without missing a beat) And thank you for driving me home to get my spare set of car keys. INT. CHARLIE’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER 27 pt Charlie and Cam hum along toward Cam’s apartment.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Take a left up here at the light. A moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know how smart it was to leave the car running.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Trust me. It’s going to be fine. It’s a Geo Metro. A car-jacker wouldn’t get caught dead in a Geo Metro. (then) Right at the stop sign.  They drive for a moment or two. CAM (cont‘d) So what were you doing this evening? Before I interrupted. Charlie pauses...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Well, I’m sorry anyway.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m not. She turns her face so that Charlie can’t see the

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (pointing) This is it. 27 pt Charlie pulls the car over. CAM (cont ’‘d) Keep the meter running. 37. tiny smile. 27 pt Cam gets out of the car and then suddenly looks annoyed. CAM (cont‘d) Aaw shit shit shit shit shit shit! (then) Excuse my french.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t speak French - what were you saying?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (thoroughly annoyed) My house keys are on my car key ring. (then) It doesn’t matter. Cam goes to the sidewalk and picks up a brick. She chucks through the window by her door and reaches in to unlock i

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (in car; sotto) What the hell?  38. Cam is gone for a few moments and then comes out carrying set of keys. She gets back into the car.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Thanks. Charlie just stares at her in disbelief. Cam looks down a the keys in her hand. CAM (cont ‘d) I hope these are the right keys. Charlie shakes his head, amused, and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW Charlie’s convertible as it makes its way throu the car garage. It rolls to a stop. PULL OUT to REVEAL that the garage is TOTALLY EMPTY. Cam’s car is GONE. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Eh, who wants to drive a Geo Metro, anyway? Another moment. Then, sheepishly... CAM (cont‘d) Would you like me to walk home? Charlie smiles and pulls away to take Cam home. 29 INT. CHARLIE’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER 29 The perfect pair drive back toward Cam's apartment. A mom of silence. Then Cam tries to break it.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: My brother calls me Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Murphy?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You know, “Murphy’s Law”. Anything that can go wrong, will. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 39. CAM (cont'd) When I was eight, I got kicked out of Brownies for starting a fire.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Doesn't starting a camp fire earn you a merit badge?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Not when it torches your camp mother’s summer home. (with a impish shrug) I was trying to make a s’more.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I love s’mores. She smiles. Looks around his dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: So many buttons. “Seat Warmer?” “Mapping Navigator?” What's this one do? She pushes it. The convertible top starts to CLOSE from behind. It catches the wind going 65 MPH and FLIES OFF TH CAR WITH A LOUD CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (flat) Convertible top. EXT. CAM’S APARTMENT - LATER 30 Charlie pulls up and idles in front of her building. The convertible top to his car rests (broken) in the backseat

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Thank you. Sorry about your back... and your top... (she motions to the back) And I owe you gas money.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What if we had dinner at a gas station? We could have chili- cheese-dogs and share a soda and you could square up for the gas that way. She gets out of the car and leans in.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You seem very nice.  40.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Translation: Not a chance in hell.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Thanks again. She shoots him a quick smile, closes the car door and tur to go to her apartment. RIPPPP! She’s suddenly standing there in her PENGUIN PANTIES, her skirt caught in the car door. Charlie opens up the door, hands her the skirt. She covers up, backs away... CAM (cont ‘d) Good night, Dr. Kagan.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Good night, Murphy. 31 EXT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE - LATER THAT NIGHT 31 ESTABLISHING -- Charlie pulls into his driveway and heads the front door. 32 INT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 32 He turns on a light to find his titanic office assistant, Reba, SITTING ON HIS COUCH in an overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: Hi, Dr. Kagan. Charlie is startled.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Reba. What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: Sorry. I didn’t mean to scare you. I used the key you left me in case of emergencies. Charlie puts his coat down and turns on another light. A long beat. Reba doesn’t move. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And the emergency is...?

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: I know about the charm. (Charlie looks at her, dumbfounded) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBA (cont'd) Somebody posted about you on my internet dating site.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Wait a second. This is totally out of control. It’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: That’s what I thought. But then I went to Urban-Legends-Dot-Com and nobody has disproved it. (then; random) Did you know that Walt Disney was cremated and not frozen?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Reba, I‘ll see you on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: (changing tact) Dr. Kagan, you’ve always been there for me.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (clarifying) When you need a day off, yes. When you need a lift to work, yes.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: When Reggie died four years ago, you sent that beautiful card. Remember what you wrote? (recalling) “If there’s anything I can do, please let me know.”

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (flustered) Yes, but...

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: (matter-of-factly) Well, I’m letting you know. Reba throws off her coat to REVEAL that she’s wearing LAC GARTERS and a BUSTIER that could hold up a house. She sta to stalk him around the living room. He backs away.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This is not what I had in mind.  33 42.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: These panties are edible. But I'd avoid the tush area as I’ve been sitting for about three hours.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Reba, I’m not the guy for you.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: I’m not saying you are. But the next guy might be. If we're together, I’1l find my soul mate.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: During the Antarctic winter, temperatures average negative 76 degrees. The winds howl at speeds of up to 200 miles per hour. As she talks, WE SEE Charlie rounding the bend munching o popcorn. CAM (cont'd) Emperor penguins are the only species that can breed during these winter conditions. Cam looks down to see Charlie on the conveyer belt. He smiles up at her. She falters momentarily, but continues. CAM (cont‘d) The female lays a single egg, then rolls it onto the feet of the male. The male stands and incubates the egg until it hatches -- about 65 days. Having built up a thick layer of fat to sustain him through the long winter, he never leaves the egg to hunt for food. The female, who spends the entire incubation period foraging in the ocean, returns before the chick hatches. (finishing) You can find out more about the Emperor Penguin at one of the many information kiosks. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask. She puts the microphone down and hops over the conveyer b moving toward Charlie. As she goes, she knocks the microphone over -- it falls into the gear of the conveyor belt and -- HORRIBLE SCREECH -- SNAPS the microphone cord While trying to rescue the cable, she snaps one heel off shoe.  55. dialogues.text: Learning about the Emperor Penguin. Having some popcorn.
