Charlie shoots him a look -- “don’t talk like that”. STU (cont'd) (dumbfounded) Have you even kissed this girl yet? (Charlie shakes his head) And you‘re going cold turkey for her?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: If she wants me more like a Gentoo, then I’m going to be more like a Gentoo.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You lost me.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: A Gentoo is a monogamous penguin.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Did you go off your meds? Charlie EXITS Stu’s office and walks through the waiting filled with beautiful buxom women -- but Charlie doesn’t notice. He just shrugs back to Stu with a goofy smile. As we follow him out (like in the earlier scene), we see quick glimpse of GARY BUSEY in the waiting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam and Charlie walk down the moonlit beach, focused more each other than the crashing waves and strolling lovers around them.  64.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Do sharks get cavities?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You have no idea, do you? Charlie shakes his head, caught.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Isn’t the point of 100 questions to ask personal questions? To learn about the other person?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I’ve learned that you don’t know the average birth weight of an African Dik-Dik. I think that’s just important as you knowing my favorite food is soup. (then) Okay, your question.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Why penguins?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Why teeth?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: My question. I asked first.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Lots of reasons. For one, you can’t help but smile when you see a penguin.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Another trait they share with you.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Their world, Antarctica, is beautiful. I go there once a year for research. Because of the Earth’s axis, there’s only one sunrise and one sunset a year. You don’t know beauty until you’ve seen a once-a-year sunset in Antarctica.  65.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (taking her in) I don’t know about that. She blushes a little. A nice moment.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: And their rituals are fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Penguin rituals? Charlie’s cell phone RINGS. He silences it immediately. CHARLIE (cont’d) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (nodding) Rituals. Like when a male penguin is sweet on a female, he goes on a long search across the beach to find the perfect pebble to offer her. He hunts everywhere to find it. Finally, he waddles over and presents the stone by placing it at her webbed feet. If she accepts his offer, they will be life-long mates.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Like an engagement ring?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (nodding) It’s unbelievable to watch. They quietly pass a couple of teenagers making out in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I have a feeling that you’re a very good kisser. I mean, I’ve already spent an hour and a half inside your mouth, so I should know.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (playful) What makes you think I’1l be kissing you? (then) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 54 55 66. CAM (cont'd) Might I remind you that with penguins, mate selection is up to the female. Cam, who’s been looking at Charlie, walks face first into wooden pier plank. She falls back to the sand.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (falling to his knees) You alright?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Ow. He leans in. He kisses her head. Cheek. They touch lips. Gentle. Soft. A perfect kiss. He pulls away slowly, and..

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe I was wrong about the “very good kisser” thing. She laughs loudly and tackles him into the sand. She star to walk away in mock offense. CHARLIE (cont’d) Hey, I’m sorry. Everybody has something they’re good at. I’m sure we'll find yours! He starts to chase her down, as we... MONTAGE -- Through a number of dates. -- They stand against the rail, watching the rippling wat as they snuggle aboard the Bahia Belle, a Mississippi-sty stern wheeler that cruises Mission Bay.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Okay, so fess up about this charm.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You know about it? (she nods; “of course”) And what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I think it’s a pretty creative way to get laid. -- Holding hands while walking through the Prado area in Balboa Park, taking in the sublime Spanish Moor Architect -- Picnicking on the grass in front of the gigantic bould torso of the BEAR SCULPTURE at UCSD.  56 57 58 67. -- Dining at Bertand’s at Mister A’s and watching the 56 cityscape from it’s panoramic view. She opens a beautiful wrapped gift. REVEAL that he’s bought her a “LO-JACK”. -- Finally, we find our two STOMPING GRAPES and making wi at the Julian Grape Stomp Fest. It’s only a matter of seconds before it turns into a dunking contest where both losers. This leads us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Cam share a CARRIAGE RIDE in the beautiful to outside of San Diego that is nestled in the Cuyamaca Mountains. But they aren’t seeing any of it, making out like two sch kids in the back of the carriage. Charlie’s hands go for bra clasp. He fumbles around for what seems like an eternity.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: First time? Charlie is shivering almost imperceptibly. It’s unclear i the cause is the crisp air or the moment.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: With you, it almost feels like it. Her smile warms him. With a mischievous grin, Cam takes her bra off under her shirt. She holds it out for him.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I think you were looking for this. Charlie is speechless. In the blink of an eye, he’s Woody Allen.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So... you’re okay with... us... you know... getting a little more...

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (frisky) Do I need to provide written instructions? Charlie quickly turns to the driver of the carriage:  68.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Um... we'll be getting off here.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (sotto; suggestively) Yes, you will. The two love-birds stumble out of the coach and immediate disappear into the nearby Cuyamaca park, already starting remove each other’s clothes. RING. His cell phone goes off. It’s a DIFFERENT SOUNDING RING this time...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This is not happening.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It’s the emergency line. I’m sorry. (peeling her off of him) I promise, I‘ll make it fast. Charlie roots through his pants and finds the ringing cel phone. He moves away to answer it. CHARLIE (cont’d) Dr. Kagan speaking. INTERCUT STU IN HIS APARTMENT.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Dude... One word and Charlie already knows who it is.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This better be an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You're gonna want to hear this. Charlie looks over to Cam who is now stretched out on som rocks. Her hands aren’t waiting for Charlie to come back. She enjoys giving him a show.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m hanging up now.  69. sTU Wait. Have you boned her yet?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Fine, if you wanna lose Cam forever, hang up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (taking the bait) What are you talking about? sTU That charm thing. Turns out it’s a curse. I’m telling you, you shake the sheets with Cam, she’s going to Marry the next person she dates!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We both know that’s bullshit. Twenty yards away, Cam moans.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (calling out; writhing) I hope there’s some left for you when you get back.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well I started calling your exes to take the Hummer on a little bush patrol, if you know what I mean. (then) And they’re married. Every single one you closed the deal with.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You'd think so, right? But you'd be wrong! A to Z on your palm pilot. Cathleen Alexander to Jeannie Zokovitch. All married. As he talks, Stu looks at the wedding announcements page the paper.  59 70. STU (cont'd) Even Tracey! The nurse! The girl you brought to Katie’s wedding? (loudly) She’s marrying the best man! The guy right after you! Charlie is speechless. Stu picks up a piece of paper from his couch and dusts away the pizza crumbs. STU (cont'd) And did you see this month’s high school newsletter. Kari Lizer.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What? The girl I lost my virginity to?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Did you see who she wound up marrying? Bobby Romanus. That douchebag she dumped you for. Charlie is silent. STU (cont'd) Are you there? Charlie turns back to see Cam standing on top of the rock TOTALLY NAKED and grinning ear to ear. She gives a playfu wave.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (sotto; into phone) I hate you. I really, really hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie pulls up out front. A long, awkward moment. Cam looks straight ahead, clearly too embarrassed to move.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Well... thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I should probably go. Dental emergency and all. Cam nods her head, disappointed and a little flustered.  60 71.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) I’ve never heard of somebody cracking fourteen teeth before.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (caught; vamping) Yeah... Freak industrial accident. (quickly; off Cam’s dubious look) I should really go. INT. CAM’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS 60 Joe sits on the couch with a bong watching “Teletubbies” surrounded with bags of empty potato chips. Beat. He giggles at the screen. Another beat. A LOUD CRASH as a brick is thrown in the front window by door. A hand UNLOCKS the door. Cam enters and plops down the couch next to him, looking disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Forgot your keys again? She nods, pulling her bra out of her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Didn’t know you were here.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (offering her a chip) How’d your date go?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: It could have gone better. (vexed) He’s playing hard to get.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: How are you playing it?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I dry-humped a hitching post in front of him. Cam sinks further into her chair and grabs the bag of Bug  61 72.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: So, what’s the biggie? I thought you weren’t into this guy.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Me either. It’s just... the way he looks at me sometimes. When I’m around him, I feel like we’re the only ones there. You know?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (nods) I feel the same way around Mary. Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Stu walk past sun-tanning beauties and make t way across the concrete-paved den of skin.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You really want to go through with this?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (determined) I’ve got to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: This is gonna get ugly.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I have to do it. I’ve got to put the curse to the test. (then) Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (pointing) She’s usually beached over there by that diving board. They start to walk toward the far side of the pool. They approach three people on a towel -- wait a minute -- that not three people -- it’s ONE! STU (cont’d) There she is. Eleanor Skepple.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And she’s single? (off Stu’s look) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE (cont'd) What? There’s somebody for everybody.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: She’s here every day. Always ina two piece. In addition to the back acne, she’s got front acne and side acne. See the glass of water by her garbage bag of ding-dongs? She keeps her teeth in that glass. She’s grouchy, angry, rude, never tips and has more chest hair than Rin Tin Tin. A beat as Charlie considers this.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Is she my best bet?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Sink the soldier all you want, there's no way this chick is getting married. If she were the last woman on Earth, humanity would come to a screeching halt. Charlie takes a deep breath, then bravely proceeds. Charlie walks past a dozen HOT, HOT, HOT GIRLS in bikinis He stops by Eleanor Skepple. She glares up to him.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR SKEPPLE
dialogues.text: Hey asshole, you’re in my sun.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hi. My name is Charlie. What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR SKEPPLE
dialogues.text: Kate Moss. Now beat it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I was just wondering if I could take you out tonight. (nothing; beat) What do you say to that? Eleanor FARTS IN RESPONSE.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR SKEPPLE
dialogues.text: Would you like me to elaborate?  62 63 74.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No, I think I understand. I’m very sorry to bother you. Charlie starts to walk away, defeated. Then turns back. CHARLIE (cont’d) I’1l give you a hundred dollars to go on a date with me. She doesn’t respond. CHARLIE (cont’d) Two hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor and Charlie are on a date at the beautiful Hotel Coronado. Eleanor eats a lobster. Charlie has a dozen sho glasses in front of him -- half empty, half full.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR SKEPPLE
dialogues.text: A lucky charm, huh? He nods. Eleanor sucks the “green stuff” from her lobster Charlie throws back another shot, working up the courage. ELEANOR SKEPPLE (cont'd) And you just gotta take me out for dinner? Charlie downs another two shots. Here goes nothing...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Well... I was kinda thinking we could... get physical.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR SKEPPLE
dialogues.text: Alright! I haven’t gotten any action since my last gyno exam. She flashes a hideous smile, green slime hanging from her teeth. Shot. Shot. Shot. INT. CHARLIE’S BATHROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT 63 Charlie is standing in his shower, scrubbing himself raw a soapy sponge. Thank God for JUMP CUTS.  64 65 66 67 68 75. He shuts off the water, breathing a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And now... we wait. INT. CAM’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 64 Cam gets home and pushes the button on her answering mach

dialogues.speaker: ANSWERING MACHINE
dialogues.text: You have one new message. She smiles and pushes PLAY. CHARLIE’S VOICE (ON MACHINE) Hey Cam, I hope you had a nice day at work. (cough, cough) Listen. I’m sorry. But I’ve got this cough I can’t seem to shake. Think we can just talk tonight. On the phone. I’d really, really like that... Cam smiles. She’d like that, too. As we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC UP: The EELS’ COVER OF THE RUTLES’ “I Must Be In Love”. TIME LAPSE of Charlie and Cam on the phone togethe as, separately, they watch T.V., cook dinner, drive in the car, lounge around the house, and iSight wit each other online. INTERCUT with this are shots from their personal lives. 6 Charlie continuing to work on patients, Cam in the Pengui Habitat (at one point video-taping the birds for research We also see Charlie actively trying to make himself “unavailable” to the many women who are still pursuing hi We see him slipping on a wedding ring before welcoming fe clients into the office. He puts out a PHOTOSHOPPED pictu of himself with a UNKNOWN BRIDE in his office to make it like he’s already married. We even see him camouflaging h appearance as he heads out to his car. All the while he and Cam enjoy each other’s phone company laughing, smiling and most of all, happy.  69 70 71 76. INT. STU’S OFFICE - THE NEXT DAY 69 Stu looks unhappier than we’ve ever seen him.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: No way. No way, man.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You gotta do it. sTU Yeah, right! So I go out with Eleanor Skepple to test the curse and what happens next? I’m walking down the aisle with Shamu! I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’‘1ll pay you.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I don’t need your money. I’ve got Mira Sorvino’s thigh fat. I’m going to be a wealthy man.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Come on, there’s got to be something I can offer you. Stu thinks for a moment. An idea... INT. CHARLIE’S OFFICE - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS 70 STU WALKS OUT FROM THE OFFICE. He wears a white jacket wi the name “Dr. Kagan” stitched onto the chest. He turns to the half-dozen waiting women.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Hello, ladies... I’m Dr. Kagan. Who's first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu and Charlie stand by the shallow end. The diving boar in the distance. Stu screws up his courage and walks towa Eleanor.  72 77. Charlie’s P.O.V. -- from a distance, Charlie watches with satisfaction as Stu chats it up with Eleanor. INT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE/CAM’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - NIGHT 72 Charlie and Cam are on the phone. They each soak in a bub bath. Completely pruned, it’s obvious that they have been talking for hours.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you’re still sick. How long has it been?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Almost two weeks. It’s killing me, but I don’t want to infect you.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: At this point, I wouldn’t mind. (girly giggle) God, I feel like a kid again. I haven’t talked to someone on the phone this much since high school.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Which reminds me... what are you doing for prom?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I love your voice. The crazy thing is... I can’t picture you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m 6'2”, steely blue eyes, washboard abs.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something... Are you avoiding actually seeing me?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What? Are you kidding me? I’m dying to see you.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Come over. Right now. Wash my back. (silence) I’ll wear a mask. We can both wear masks. We'll play doctor.  78.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, God, I want to so badly, but...

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: “But” nothing. I need to see you. I need to see if that birthmark you have really looks like Alfred Hitchcock. Charlie bites his tongue, not knowing what to say. CAM (cont ’d) Okay. If I can’t see you, maybe we could at least take our phone relationship to the next level.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean? She puts on a SEXY VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Mmmm, yeah. Oh, yeah. Do you like that?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (out of character) That’s my phone sex voice. Work with me here. (sexy again) Sometimes when I’m out of batteries, I like to use my electric toothbrush.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Um, I don’t think this is a good idea. We probably shouldn’t do anything that feels like sex...

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: It’s just a little phone sex.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Eh, I don’t know if that’s against the-- Charlie HEARS A BUZZING SOUND coming from the phone...  73 79. CHARLIE (cont’d) (quickly) Ooops, other line. Gotta go. He hurriedly clicks OFF THE PHONE. Frustrated. The PHONE RINGS. He looks down at call waiting and quickl picks it up. CHARLIE (cont’d) Stuey. Talk to me. INTERCUT STU - who is placing a large grapefruit (with a penis-sized hole in it) into the microwave.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: The deed is done. I went out with Eleanor. And I’m not proposing to her. So you’re in the clear. (then) Are you there? REVEAL Charlie’s phone sitting on the edge of the bathtub trail of water leading out the bathroom door. Gone!

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CAM’S APARTMENT - A SHORT TIME LATER 73 Charlie is standing in front of Cam’s door. She opens it wearing sweats, surprised to see him there.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn’t call. I couldn’t wait.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: What happened to your cough?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (with a shrug) Devine intervention. I guess God just wants to see us have sex. Cam smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Well, I hate to disappoint.  74 80. And with that, she pulls him inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we've arrived at the requisite “love making” montage between Charlie and Cam. MUSIC SWELLS as they start to ma love. Halfway through the scene, we see Cam detach a VIDEO CAME from its tripod and smile over to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I think we need a well-documented historical record of this monumental occasion. How about you? Charlie nods like a puppy dog. Of course he’s game. -- Our couple takes turns with the camera as the scene continues to be beautifully shot and scored. Think “9 1/2 Weeks” meets “Red Shoe Diaries”. Back-lit. Primary colore lights wash over their gorgeous bodies. As the MUSIC FADES, we DISSOLVE to them in bed together. Snuggled in a stop-the-hands-of-time embrace. A poetic moment. Then... both of them rise up quickly with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: CAM CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I can’t wait any longer. Put in the tape. Put in the tape. Cam quickly attaches a cable to the T.V., jumps back into with the remote and presses PLAY. CLOSE ON THEIR FACES as they watch the screen. They each simultaneously tilt their heads to the side, trying to decipher the image. CAM (cont ‘d) Is that my nipple?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (shaking his head slowly) I think it’s a pimple on my back. After a moment, they both get a look of HORROR on their f and RUSH TO TURN OFF THE TAPE.  75 76 gl.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE CAM
dialogues.text: Turn it off, good God, turn We’ve made a terrible it off. mistake! INT. CAM’S BEDROOM - LATE NIGHT 75 Cam sleeps peacefully. Charlie next to her, gazing at her perfect face. Lit by the flicker of the television. A gentle moment. Then...

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (without opening her eyes) Stop looking at me. You’re freakin’ me out. Charlie smiles warmly and rolls over. On the T.V., a LOCA NEWS PROGRAM is on. The CHYRON reads: “OBESITY IN AMERICA There are quick shots of FAT PEOPLE as a reporter talks t the camera (the sound muted). SUDDENLY, Charlie’s face fills with panic. He moves for t TIVO remote and hits PAUSE. REVERSE. BACK. BACK. BACK. STOP. On the SCREEN -- a PAUSED IMAGE that is clearly ELEANOR SKEPPLE -- KISSING A HEFTY MAN.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!!! INT. CAM’S APARTMENT - MOMENTS LATER 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie paces and whispers loudly into his phone.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Wake up! Wake up! Wake up! INTERCUT -- Stu picking up the phone in his bed.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (half-asleep) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (controlling his panic) “The deed is done!” “The deed is done!?!”  82. sTU It’s five o’clock in the morning. What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The deed. I’m talking about the deed. I thought you went out with Eleanor Skepple.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Naw, I just said that.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What?!? CAM’S VOICE (0.S.) (from the other room) Charlie? Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (shielding phone) Everything’s fine, sweetie. I’1l be back in a minute. (into phone; incredulous) You just “said that”?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I didn’t want to risk it. Marrying her.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I saw you with her! You asked her out!!!

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: No. I asked her what time it was. It was 3:52.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I trusted you. You are no longer my friend.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Can I still pretend to be you?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No. You can’t be me. I’mme. TI never want to talk to you again. Ever. Ever ever.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You're really going to let a girl come between us?  77 83.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Not a girl. The girl. (then; definitively) And now I’m going to lose her. Charlie slams down the phone as his words hang in the air He takes a deep breath. Shakes his head sadly and contemplates for a beat. The wheels start to turn in his head. Sadness turns to anger which turns to steely resolv He starts to psych himself up. CHARLIE (cont’d) (determined) No. I’m not going to lose her. PUSH INTO Charlie’s crazed eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Cam, who is sleeping soundly. A cup of coffee co into frame and is swirled about. A smile comes over her:

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Mmmm... breakfast in bed. Her eyes open as we PULL OUT to REVEAL that it is TRULY BREAKFAST IN BED. The entire bed is filled with food. It looks like she woke up in the middle of the Bellagio buffet in Vegas. Scrambled eggs, omelettes, fried eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, toast, muffins, pancakes, waffl crepes, every imaginable kind of juice, etc. cam is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to eat my way out?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I just thought you’d like a little breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (a little confused) Thank you.  78 84. She sits up (careful not to spill anything) and picks up piece of toast. She looks over to Charlie, who looks a little tweaked. CAM (cont‘d) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Couldn’t be happier. You okay? Cam nods. She studies him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You’re acting kind of strange.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m not acting strange. He sits down on the edge of the bed, trying to look natur Cam just looks at him, “What the hell is going on?” CHARLIE (cont’d) So, what do you want to do today?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Well... I’ve got to go to work.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Right. Of course. Work. Me, too. (then) How about Saturday night? Or Sunday? Say Wednesday? Cam looks him over. What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Can we play it by ear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu and Charlie brave the morning traffic to walk to work Charlie dials his cell phone and waits for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hey, Cam. How’s it going? (then) I just wanted to make sure I had your right cell number. Got it. No worries. Everything’s cool. (beat) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 85. CHARLIE (INTO PHONE) (cont'd) And I’m looking forward to Saturday night. And Sunday. And Wednesday. Okay, bye. Charlie flips the phone off. Stu looks over to him, wanti to say something, but doesn’t. A beat later, Charlie flips the phone open again and dial CHARLIE (INTO PHONE) (cont’d) (acting surprised) Cam? Cam, is that you? Oh, my God, I must have dialed you instead by accident. I meant to call the... library. How funny is that? (then) Right. Work. Of course. Okay, bye. Charlie flips his phone off. He and Stu continue to walk silence. Charlie opens the phone again and dials. CHARLIE (INTO PHONE) (cont‘d) Hey, guess who? Listen, I just wanted to tell you that I won’t call again. So, if you need or want to talk to me, for whatever reason, you’ll have to call me. (then) No problem. Okay, this is it. My last... transmission. This call. Here. Bye. Bye. Bye. B-- Before Charlie finishes saying “Bye” again, Stu rips the phone out of his hand, drops it on the floor, and STOMPS IT AGGRESSIVELY. The phone shatters into a million pieces After a beat, Stu continues walking.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You’re welcome. INT. CAM’S WORK - PENGUIN HABITAT - AFTERNOON 79 Cam opens the door to her office to find the room FILLED A ZILLION FLOWERS. She wades through them to find a card. It reads: “Miss you already, Charlie”. A stoned Joe shuffles up behind her.  80 86.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (flat) Is there something different in here since lunch? Cam opens the closet to hang her jacket as HUNDREDS OF RE

dialogues.speaker: CEILING.
dialogues.text: Every single one of them is shaped like a HEART.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (softly) What the he-- There is a KNOCK ON THE DOOR. Cam goes to it. FOUR MEN IN TUXES STAND AT THE DOOR. One of them blows on a tuning harmonica and then, in perf harmony, they sing a barbershop quartet version of Beyonc “Crazy in Love”:

dialogues.speaker: SINGING QUARTET
dialogues.text: (singing) I look and stare so deep in your eyes. I touch on you more and more every time. When you leave I'm beggin’ you not to go. Call your name two, three times in a row. (they start lame choreography ) Got me lookin’ so crazy right now. Your love's got me lookin’ so crazy right now. Got me lookin’ so crazy right now. Your touch's got me lookin’ so crazy right now. Joe and Cam just stare at the quartet in silence. Then...

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Hey -- you guys do Free Bird?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam makes her way toward her car. As she approaches, she slows, a look of dismay materializing on her face. PIVOT to REVEAL Cam’s car. Tin cans are tied to the back bumper and there are hearts and written in soap all over car. On the back window, a big sign reading: “ALMOST MARRIED".  81 82 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ball of nerves, Charlie bursts out of his office door ( see that his name-plate is missing for some reason). He walks across the hallway to Stu’s office. As he opens door, he stops momentarily to notice that his own name pl has been duct-tapped on top of Stu’s. Hmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie comes barging into Stu’s office. Stu is knee-deep into some heavy-petting with a BLONDE.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (sweet talking) If you were a hamburger at McDonald's... I’d name you McBeautiful.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Stu. I need you. It’s important. sTU (covering) Hmmm? My name is Dr. Charlie Kagan. I don’t know who this Stu is that you speak of. Charlie doesn’t want to waste any time. He takes out his wallet and shows his DRIVER’S LICENSE to the blonde. She immediately SLAPS STU and storms out of the office. STU (cont’d) (calling after her) I’1l call you. Charlie closes the door and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’ve been thinking. Cam is going to fall in love and get married to the next guy that she dates. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE (cont'd) (off Stu’s blank stare) I’m going to be that guy.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You lost me at “hello”.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (explaining) You're a plastic surgeon. You're going to completely change my face to make me look like a different person. Then I'll be the next person she falls in love with.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Charlie, in the history of bad ideas, that falls somewhere in between New Coke and JFK saying “let's take the convertible.”

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So you’re not going to help me? sTU Yes, by not rearranging your face. (sitting him down) Get a grip, man. There’s got to be another way. A long beat. Then, a look of enlightenment washes over Charlie’s face.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Why hadn’t I thought of it before?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (facetiously) What? Time machine? Clone her?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’1l just follow her around and keep her from meeting another guy. Stu just stares at him. Then...

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: The plastic surgery was a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (unhinged) I just have to buy myself some time till I figure out how to reverse the curse.  83 84 85 86 89. EXT. CAM’S APARTMENT - MORNING 83 A stake-out. Charlie has a donut and coffee in his car. H sees Cam EXIT her apartment. Charlie ducks in his seat, SPILLING his coffee on his lap. Ouch. He watches as Cam gets into her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam driving down the highway at a healthy clip. SUDDENLY, behind her, a POLICE CAR flashes its lights. Cam’s car pulls over. Behind them, in the distance, we se Charlie pulling over as well. INT. CHARLIE’S CAR - CONTINUOUS 85 Charlie hovers down behind his steering wheel, spying. CHARLIE’S P.O.V. -- we watch as a MUSCULAR POLICEMAN step out of his car.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (losing it) Oh, no. This isn’t good. CHARLIE’S P.O.V. -- the strapping Officer strides toward Cam’s car. CHARLIE (cont'd) It’s over. Game over. Party’s over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer knocks on Cam’s window. She rolls it down.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: License and registration, please.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Yes, officer. Cam hands the policeman her information. SUDDENLY, FROM BEHIND, a car (Charlie’s car) COMES SCREAM PAST, HONKING ITS HORN AND BREAKING THE SOUND BARRIER.  87 88 90.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (screaming out the window)

dialogues.speaker: PIG
dialogues.text: Without missing a beat, the Officer hands Cam back her documents and rushes back to his car to take pursuit. Cam looks at the speeding car with concerned confusion.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie sits in a cell with a few drunk-and-disorderlies. guard approaches the cell.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Charles Kagan? You made bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Stu step out of the jail building and into th POURING RAIN.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: So how’s the plan working out for you so far?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (dispirited) Thanks for bailing me out. (then) What are you up to tonight?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Masturbating. (then) Oh, and then I gotta go see my cousin. He found out last week that he’s got an inoperable tumor.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That’s horrible.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Yeah, he’s got like one week to live.  89 gl.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That's... perfect. He’s perfect for her. Stu stops in his tracks and stares at Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: No. No, no, no.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What’s the harm? He gets laid. She falls in love. He’s dead inside a week. I swoop in to console her. Bim, bam, boom, everybody’s happy. Stu just shakes his head in disgust and starts to walk aw CHARLIE (cont’d) What hospital is he at? (then) What?! I just want to send flowers. Stu turns on him.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Charlie, snap out of it, okay? If you love this girl, go tell her! Live happily ever after. Just avoid going nuts while you do it. Charlie nods and mouths “Thank You” and starts away... STU (cont'd) (calling after him) I doubt she’s had time to file a restraining order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie walks in and starts looking for Cam. He rides the people-mover conveyer belt. Two penguins bat a balloon ba and forth, but Cam is nowhere to be found. Charlie sees Joe in the tank, feeding the birds. He moves the glass and knocks. When Joe looks up, Charlie waves. Joe approaches the window and points to a sign that reads “Please don’t knock on glass”. Joe goes back to work.  92. Charlie glances into the gift shop. Still no Cam. He sees book on the shelf with Howard’s big smiling mug on it. Ug From out of his pocket, he pulls an ENGAGEMENT RING BOX. glances inside -- yup, just as we expected... an engageme ring. Not good. He fingers it for a moment and then re- pockets the box. FINALLY, he sees Cam enter the far end of the Penguin Tan She’s wearing a DIVE SUIT. TRIUMPHANT LOVE MUSIC SWELLS as Charlie runs toward the window -- he is about to bang on the glass (in a total "T Graduate” moment) when he remembers the sign “Please Don’ Knock on Glass”.

dialogues.speaker: BETTER IDEA
dialogues.text: Charlie sees a woman applying lipstick next to him. He ta the lipstick out of her hand and jumps up on the PEOPLE-M HAND-RAIL. Leaning against the glass, he starts to write message in GIGANTIC LETTERS. He walks along the moving rail, trying to keep his spot, avoiding stepping on passing patrons, while he writes: “I LOVE U” It’s a beautiful expression of love. The way every movie should end. FROM INSIDE THE TANK -- Joe and Cam look up at the crazy lunatic. Reading it in reverse, Charlie has written “UEVOLI”. Joe cocks his head, confused.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Is that plural for uvula? Charlie steps down from the rail, expecting the romantic climax of two lovers jumping into one another’s arms. Instead he gets TACKLED BY TWO PARK SECURITY GUARDS and wrestled to the ground. Cam and Joe run out to them to stop things before they escalate.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it!!! The Guards release Charlie, who dusts himself off.  93. CAM (cont'd) (CONT'D) Charlie, what the hell are you doing? He’s speechless.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Is this guy your friend? Cam gives an embarrassed (hardly perceptible) nod.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (sotto) Charlie, why have you been acting sO... crazy? Charlie is about to defend himself but looks around to se the crowd gathered and realizes his behavior has no defen

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: All right, yes, I’ve been acting a little crazy. But I have a reasonable explanation.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Let me guess. You’re a lucky charm and you’re afraid I might marry the next person I date. So you're acting like a nut-job trying to keep me? Charlie balks, too embarrassed to say, “exactly”. AN OLDE WOMAN uses a moment of silence to approach.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m sorry, I was eavesdropping. Are you really Charlie Kagan, the lucky charm? Because I was wondering...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I can’t. (sees Cam walking away) Wait! Cam, please. Charlie catches up to Cam (with Guards in tow).

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Listen, I think we should take a break.  90

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: “R break”? That’s code for you don’t want to date me anymore. Cam doesn’t say anything. An awkward moment. Then, out of the blue...

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (looking at the glass) Hey, look... the plural for uvula spells “I love you” backwards. Charlie pulls away from the security guards and moves to earnest and pleading. Here it is... the speech of the mov

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I love you. I’ve loved you since the first moment I saw you. (then) My entire life, I’ve been nothing more than a stepping stone for every relationship I’ve ever been in. There’s always a “next guy” who’s better than me. For once, I want to be that next guy. For once, I want to get the girl. And I want that girl to be you. A long beat. Then...

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Charlie. You're just not who I thought you were. Cam turns and walks back into the Penguin Tank. She puts her mask and jumps into the water, disappearing from Charlie’s life forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s raining. Pouring. We see Reba exiting the building, brandishing an umbrella for protection. She passes a couple of bums on the street (one huddled on bus stop bench). She stops and turns back, realizing...

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: Dr. Kagan?  95. Charlie looks up from the bench. He’s soaked and looking miserable.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hi, Reba.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: I was calling you all day. Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (flat) I decided to take the day off. (then) Hey? Do you know if our office building has roof access?

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: Things can't be that bad. (then) You know, I owe you a “thank you”. I met a guy. He’s... wonderful. I really think he’s the one.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (sincere) That’s great, Reba. Really. I’m happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: You've done a good thing. You've helped people find love. This doesn’t seem to lift Charlie’s spirits. Reba puts he umbrella over him and they sit in silence for a moment. In front of them, a HOMELESS MAN wrapped in garbage bags picks through a trash can looking for recyclables. REBA (cont’d) Do you know how many women there are out there? Waiting? For you? (pointing to the downpour) One for every raindrop. The HOMELESS MAN drops a bottle. Charlie looks down as th BOTTLE SPINS ON THE WET ASPHALT. The spinning takes on an almost magical quality.  91 96. It stops, pointing across the street. Charlie glances up see a GOTH-LOOKING GIRL standing at the bus stop (althoug different girl, she looks strikingly similar to our Goth from the opening make-out party). The girl gazes directly Charlie. Eerie. We realize that Reba has been talking the entire time. Ab what, we don’t know. REBA (cont’d) Dr. Kagan? Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (in a daze) ..-fall like rain... I’m in pain... Reba, it’s just like she said... it’s raining. All around! Reba looks him like he’s lost his marbles.

dialogues.speaker: REBA
dialogues.text: That’s why... I’m holding... an umbrella over you.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (starting to focus) No! Not rain. Love. Raining love. But I’m in pain. See? (searching for words) “Once they've been with you... they’1l find true...” Omigod! Seeing things clearly for the first time, Charlie dashes in the rain. Reba sits alone on the bench, confused. INT. CAM’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS 91 Cam brushes the feathers of a sickly looking penguin.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (gently; to the bird) I’m so sorry, little buddy. Joe enters and sits down next to them.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: What’s up with Jester?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: His girlfriend died. (gently brushing him) He stopped grooming himself. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92 97. CAM (cont'd) (disheartened) This is the hardest part of this job. Almost worst than losing one. He’1l probably never try to find someone to replace her. Joe slides over and helps to pamper the poor little guy. CAM (cont‘d) It’s heart-breaking, isn’t it? To think that you can fit together with someone so completely that when they’re gone, there’s no one to fill the empty space. After a beat.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: You should call him.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: He's changed. He’s crazy.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: To quote Beyoncé: “Your love's got me lookin’ so crazy right now. Got me lookin’ so crazy right now. Your touch's got me lookin’ so crazy right now.” Have I made my point? From the look on her face, he has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie bursts in the front door without knocking.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (calling; while entering) Stu! I got it!!! I need to Google some-— Charlie immediately EXITS as quickly as he entered. He stands outside, trying to shake an image. CHARLIE (cont’d) Stu... That’s disgusting. STU‘S VOICE (0.S.) (a beat) What? I told you I was gonna be masturbating.  98.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: But... That’s disgusting. STU’S VOICE (0.S.) Hey, it’s a known fact that stimulation of the prost--

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Get dressed. (beat) And wash your hands. 93 INT. CHARLIE’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER 93 Charlie drives. Stu navigates. sTU A hex? She put a hex on you? I have no recollection of this event whatsoever. How old were we?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Ten. Eleven. It doesn’t matter. What matters is that I’m hexed.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (convinced Chuck is nuts) Okay, I think I should be driving.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (ignoring him; excited) Don’t you remember? Black lipstick. Long fingernails. Total freak. She wanted to see my penis and I wouldn’t show it to her so she pulled my nipples and put a hex on me.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Dude, did you forget to pay your brain bill?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Only she can break the spell. Stu glances at the Mapquest print-out:

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: This is the address. Stop the car. Stop the car!  94 99. Charlie pulls the car over. He stares at the house.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: How do you think I get her to break the spell?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I don’t know. She wanted to see your penis... Charlie gets out of the car and starts toward the house. STU (cont'd) (suddenly worried) Um... that was a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie walks to the front door and KNOCKS. A LITTLE 5-YEAR-OLD GIRL ANSWERS.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hi, is your mother home? The little girl just stares at him. CHARLIE (cont’d) Is your mother’s name Anisha?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: What’s with the fifty questions? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That was only two questions.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: It’s a hyperbole. From behind the little girl, a woman comes to the door. S is dressed in a flower-print dress, looking more like Lau Ashley than Marilyn Manson. Charlie is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh... hi... I think I have the wrong... (then; turning) Sorry to bother you.  100. She shrugs and starts to close the door. At the last mome Charlie stops the door from closing. CHARLIE (cont’d) Are you Anisha Carter?

dialogues.speaker: ANISHA
dialogues.text: (the answer clearly “yes”) Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m Charlie Kagan. He looks at her for some sign of recognition. None comes. CHARLIE (cont’d) I know this is going to sound crazy, but when we were kids, you put a hex on me so that all my girlfriends would fall in love with somebody else. And I need you to reverse the spell. Am I making any sense? Without saying anything, Anisha cautiously reaches up to shelf by her door and pulls down a can of mace. CHARLIE (cont’d) Apparently not. Charlie looks down at the little girl. She wears the identical Wicca pentagram necklace originally worn by Ani as a little girl. CHARLIE (cont'd) That was yours, wasn’t it? (to the girl) Is your mommy’s name Anisha?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: (emotionless) You gonna mace him, Mom?!? Charlie gives the girl a look. Anisha head-motions to her daughter, who reluctantly heads back inside. Shucks!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Okay, see, the problem is that we're at an impasse here. I know you know what I’m talking about but you aren't talking. And I need to know how to break the hex. This is my life we're talking about.  95 101. Anisha is still silent. CHARLIE (cont'd) What can I do to convince you? AT THE CAR -- Stu watches the scene with bemused fascinat STU'S P.O.V. -- SUDDENLY, without warning, Charlie DROPS PANTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is once again behind bars. He sits next to RUPERT 400 POUND SHAVED-BALD INMATE (with soft eyes) who hangs o his every word.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (loudly) This sucks! That’s right! I said it! Do you know why I’m in here? Do you know why? Rupert shrugs, answering in an unusually feminine voice.

dialogues.speaker: RUPERT
dialogues.text: (wild stab) Aggravated assault with a deadly weapon?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Love. Love, Rupert. I’m here because of love. Everybody else is finding love, but what about me?

dialogues.speaker: RUPERT
dialogues.text: You deserve love.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. And do I deserve to be in here? (Rupert shakes his head) Exactly! Indecent exposure, my ass! You tell me, what could possibly be indecent about trying to hold onto the only love of your life.

dialogues.speaker: RUPERT
dialogues.text: Nothing. That’s not indecent.  96 102.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (on a roll) Lucky Charm. They call me a “lucky charm!” But I’m not lucky. I’m so incredibly UN-lucky! Sure, it’s lucky for everybody else that if you have sex with me you find true love... but I’m miserable!

dialogues.speaker: RUPERT
dialogues.text: We all need love.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (getting emotional) Am I holding on too tight? Is that the problem? To happiness. To passion. To love.

dialogues.speaker: RUPERT
dialogues.text: My mother told me once, if you love something, set it free. Charlie nods his head, letting the words sink in.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Rupert. Those are lovely words. Really... lovely words. A beat. Then RUPERT leans in and provocatively says:

dialogues.speaker: RUPERT
dialogues.text: Now... how does this lucky charm work exactly? What do we have to do? Charlie’s jaw drops. He glances around the cell -- all ey on him. Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: PRISON OFFICER
dialogues.text: Charles Kagan! You made bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stands on the steps of the jailhouse. In front of him is the BUTCH FEMALE POLICE OFFICER from earlier.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Seriously, thank you. Five more seconds, and...I don’t know how to thank you...  103.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCH POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: You already did. You helped me find the love of my life. The Butch Officer grabs the hand of her FEMALE “PARTNER” standing next to her. Charlie smiles and joins Stu at the bottom of the steps. They walk toward Charlie’s car. sTU So, what’s the plan now? Let me guess, we time travel to 2097 and track down Cam’s reincarnated soul, drag her back into our world, and hope she falls in love with you? Or is it something involving the gravitational pull of the Earth?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Stu, I saw things clearly for the first time in that cell. I realized that my whole life has been spent protecting myself against love. Closing off my heart. When I should have been opening it.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: What about Cam? You opened it for Cam.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) No, see, I didn’t. What was the first thing I did when I realized that I might lose her? I went Chicken Little. I was so scared about the future that I totally ignored the present. I was so concerned about the next guy that I completely ignored this guy. I was so worried about losing my soulmate that I lost view of the fact that if I lose Cam, she isn’t my soul- mate to begin with. (then) If you love something, set it free.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Are you done? (Charlie nods) I’m going home. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 98 99 100 104. STU (cont'd) Bailing you out of jail every fifteen minutes has seriously eaten into my masturbation time. But Stu’s disposition can’t dampen Charlie’s new resolve.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE - LATER 97 SWELLLING MUSIC UP as Charlie picks up his phone and dial We REVEAL that he holds a book on Penguins, written by... HOWARD BLAINE.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m trying to find a Howard Blaine. (beat) Hi. Howard. We’ve, um, never met. But I have a friend that you need to... meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BITTERSWEET MUSIC CONTINUES as we watch Cam hustle down t street toward a COFFEE SHOP. She checks her watch and loo around the place. She approaches someone sitting with his back toward her. When the man turns, we REVEAL that it’s Howard, who greet her with a hug. She sits with a warm smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON CAM -- sitting on the lush grass. She’s laughing Having a nice time talking to Howard. They laugh some more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC CONTINUES as Howard and Cam have dinner at a fa restaurant on the water. More conversation. More bonding. Howard knocks over his glass of water. Cam bursts out laughing. These two are perfect for each other.  lol 102 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam and Howard are in the Habitat tank. Howard plays with the penguins as Cam proudly shows off her flat-footed friends, video-taping their antics with her camera. AT THE FAR END OF THE HABITAT, we see Charlie in the distance, coming around the bend on the PEOPLE MOVER. He sees Cam talking to Howard in the tank. He nods his he trying to be happy for her. But that emotion is quickly followed by dysphoria as he starts to walk backwards on t mover -- hoping they won’t see him. He walks against the grain and toward the entrance again, bumping into a RED- HEADED WOMAN as he goes. The MUSIC FADES as he slowly turns and walks out of the park... INT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 102 The room is DARK AND GLOOMY. Shutters closed. It feels li a morgue. Charlie sits on the couch. In a robe. Eyes open He could be dead. SUDDENLY, light streams in the door as Stu bursts in. He starts talking immediately.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I’m getting married!!! Charlie doesn’t move. STU (cont'd) I found my dream-girl, dude, and I just proposed and it’s all because of you. (calling outside) Lara? Come on in. A moment later, the TREMENDOUSLY STACKED AND PACKED TANK- GIRL (the one who, earlier, wouldn’t take her top off for Charlie) steps in the room. Charlie is obviously surprised to see her (and the huge r on her finger). STU (cont’d) Lara stepped out of heaven and into my office to correct a “condition”. She’s got Polymastia. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STU (cont’d) (off Charlie’s blank look) More than two boobs. You wanna see?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No, no-no-no--

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: It’s okay. I mean, if you want. (a weight lifted) I used to be embarrassed until stu made me realize how special I was. Without waiting for Charlie’s consent, Lara lifts her shi Although we don’t see the boobs (unfortunately, we see th scene from behind her), we DO see Charlie’s reaction.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Is that, or is that not, the most beautiful sight you’ve ever seen? It’s like seeing the Grand Canyon for the first time, like seeing Earth from space, like seeing the Olsen Twins make out with each other. Lara puts down her shirt and Stu baby-kisses her a couple times, getting lovey-dovey. Charlie smiles meekly.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m happy for you, buddy. sTU But that’s not the reason we came. (then; changing subjects) You know, it smells like cheese in here. Gouda, maybe? You might want to open a window. (to Lara; back on point) Okay, tell him, baby.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I’m friends with Katie and she told me that Cam Wexler--

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: --Cam, Cameron, your Cam--

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (nodding; curt) I know who she is.  103 107.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Anyway, Katie said that Cam said that she’s leaving for Antarctica with some penguin guru. A beat as Charlie takes this in. Calmly...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That’s good. I’m happy for her. Stu stares at Charlie, waiting for him to come to his sen Over the course of 30 seconds, we watch as Charlie goes through all 7 stages of grief. Then, common sense finally kicks in. CHARLIE (cont’d) What the fuck am I doing?!?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: That's what I’m saying to you! CHARLIE SPEEDILY STARTS GETTING DRESSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie drives up to a stoplight, cell phone to his ear. the seat next to him is ENGAGEMENT RING BOX from earlier.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Joe, you're not listening to me. I need to know where Cam is. (beat) Your sister. The signal is taking too long -- Charlie hops out of the runs over to PRESS THE PEDESTRIAN SIGNAL to hurry the lig change up. Still on the phone: CHARLIE (cont'd) Joe, I need you to focus for a moment. This is important! (then; quickly) What time? What airline? What flight? (beat; then annoyed) Cam! Your sister. The light still hasn’t changed. There hasn’t been one car the road since he stopped. Charlie YELLS in frustration. hangs up the phone and looks both ways. Not a car in sight. The light still red.  104 105 106 108. Charlie GUNS IT across the street. Three seconds later, a whirring light and siren behind hi He looks into the rearview -- a COP. Shit! He pulls over. OUT OF THE POLICE CAR steps the SAME POLICE OFFICER WHO RECENTLY SENT HIM TO JAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is on the phone again, speeding along the freeway On the seat next to him is the engagement ring box AND A NEWLY WRITTEN TRAFFIC TICKET.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: That’s good enough. I mean, how many flights could there be to Antarctica? Thank you! I just might make it. Behind him, a siren and lights. He pulls over. Charlie sinks in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is speeding along the freeway AGAIN. On the seat next to him is the engagement ring box AND A NEWLY WRITTE SPEEDING TICKET to go along with the traffic ticket. SUDDENLY, a siren and lights. He pulls over AGAIN. OUT OF THE POLICE CAR steps the SAME OFFICER WHO WROTE HI SPEEDING TICKET 8 lines ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is driving SLOWLY and CAUTIOUSLY down the freeway The POLICE CAR follows behind him, waiting for any law- breaking. Charlie sees an EXIT for the BEACH. Using BOTH HIS BLINKE SIGNAL AND A HAND-SIGNAL TO TURN OFF the freeway, he take the exit. Where is he going? What the hell?  107 108 109 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie walks out to a rocky inlet of the ocean. The wate breaks upon the rocks dramatically. Charlie walks out int the sand. Double what the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie PULLS UP to the terminal and darts toward the doo A TRAFFIC COP YELLS FOR HIM TO STOP but Charlie runs insi the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie approaches the ticket counter.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Has the flight to Antarctica boarded yet?

dialogues.speaker: AIR ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Which one? There are two.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Has the one with a passenger named Cam Wexler boarded yet?

dialogues.speaker: AIR ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, sir, I can’t give you that information. Charlie starts to move toward the gate... AIR ATTENDANT (cont‘d) Sir, you won’t be able to go the gate without a ticket. Charlie takes out his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'd like a ticket to Antarctica. Actually, I'd like two tickets to Antarctica. One on each plane.

dialogues.speaker: AIR ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: There are only first class tickets available, sir.  110 lil 112 110.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (defeated) Of course there are. The Air Attendant starts typing on the computer. Charlie looks on anxiously. He glances outside to see his CAR BEING TOWED AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: AIR ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Are you travelling with any baggage?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: AIR ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: You do realize that it’s negative sixty degrees?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Please. Hurry. She nods and prints out the tickets.

dialogues.speaker: AIR ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: That will be seventeen thousand, four hundred and twelve dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie passes through security. They make him take off h shoes. His belt. They scan him down with the hand-held wa just to make it go a little slower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie makes his way onto the first plane, just boarding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks through the plane, side-stepping boarding passen wearing parkas and carrying heavy winter coats.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Cam? cCam!?! No Cam.  113 114 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the other side of the terminal, Charlie sees Cam boarding the other flight. He RUSHES OVER, giving his second ticket to the STEWARDES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam finds her seat. She is about to put her carry-on into the overhead compartment. CHARLIE’S VOICE Here, let me help you with that.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Thank you. She turns, surprised, to see Charlie standing next to her Charlie's CAM (cont ’d) Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Don’t be mad. (to Howard, sitting in the center seat) Antarctica? You couldn’t just take in a movie? (then) Cam, I know it seems a little crazy that I’ve showed up here but I have to tell you in all honesty that it felt even crazier NOT to show up. (on a roll) It’s just that when you find the right person, it feels wrong to fight it. (shaking his head) Oh, God, this was a bad idea, wasn’t it? I mean, you’re going away with... Howard. face drops, giving in to the inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Charlie, have you met Howard's wife, Marilyn. The red-headed MARILYN sits at the window. She looks up a smiles politely. Charlie stands there, shocked.  115 116 117 118 112. WE SEE A FLASHBACK WIPE -- (a la “Sixth Sense”, we get to the scenes as they REALLY were). CAM AT THE PARK WITH HOWARD. The camera PULLS back a litt further than before to REVEAL that sitting next to them w Marilyn, enjoying the conversation. CAM AT THE RESTAURANT WITH HOWARD. The camera DOLLIES OVH little to REVEAL Marilyn was also there. Howard spills hi drink again and they all laugh. CAM AND HOWARD IN THE PENGUIN TANK. We see Charlie backin off the People Mover. He BUMPS INTO the red-headed Marily as he makes his way out of the park. BACK TO THE PRESENT --— 118 Charlie realizes he’s made an awful, awful mistake.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, wow. I um... I had to see you. I couldn’t let you go to Antarctica without seeing you again.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: But I’1l be back on Wednesday. A long beat. A very long beat.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So, maybe I‘1l call you on Thursday. (then) Or Friday. Better yet, why don’t you call me? Cam moves closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Howard told me about your call. Charlie braces himself for the slap. CAM (cont'd) That was the nicest thing anyone has ever said about me.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So I embellished a little bit. (off her smile) A lot. I embellished a lot. What can I say, you’re a tough sell.  113.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: If you wanted me so badly, why did you work so hard to get Howard to meet me?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Mate selection is up to the female. I thought I’d give the other birds a chance. (then; with a shrug) I knew you wanted to meet him. I knew it would make you happy. She smiles and kisses him lightly on the cheek. CHARLIE (cont’d) So... you forgive me for acting crazy?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Not even a little bit. (then) But I’m willing to wipe the slate clean. Start from square one. Before square one.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’ll pretend that I don’t know you again.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: And I’1l pretend that I don’t like you again. Charlie looks over to Howard who is holding hands with hi wife.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He’s married? (she nods; excited) That makes it even better that I called him! She smiles at his off-center sense of humor.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Listen, when I get back, no more flowers, or balloons, or telegrams, or... monkey-grams...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I promise.  119 114.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: And when I trip over myself, I expect you to still laugh at me.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Okay. (then) I won't just laugh, I’1l point.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (nodding) So, I'll see you when I get back. A FEMALE PASSENGER sitting two rows back pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PASSENGER
dialogues.text: Excuse me, aren’t you Charlie Ka--

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Can it. He’s mine. And with that, she gives him a kiss that literally change the cabin’s air pressure. They pull apart. Charlie is abo to leave, but...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, I almost forgot. He hands her the ENGAGEMENT BOX. She looks down at it, worried -- he's acting crazy again already. Without another word, Charlie EXITS the plane. Slowly, suspiciously, Cam opens the box. INSIDE -- is a PEBBLE. A tiny, perfect stone. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Ex-Goth Girl) Anisha Carter kisses her daughter good nig She walks toward her room as we hear the following in V.0

dialogues.speaker: CAM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I promise to sleep by your side, to warm your body and heart, and to nurture your soul. I promise to laugh with you when times are good, and suffer with you when they are bad... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 115. CAM (V.O.) (cont'd) and most of all, I promise never to make you live off your own fat. We follow Anisha into her bedroom. She OPENS a SECRET ROO in the back of her closet to REVEAL (to our surprise) a v assortment of WITCHCRAFT PARAPHERNALIA. We continue to he the vows...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (0.S8.)
dialogues.text: I promise to be your Gentoo. I will wash your tears away with my kisses and never let you stray too far away from my soul. I promise to be your safe haven in this life, to never take you for granted, but to always give you your space... especially if you're tripping or walking into doors. I love you. As the vows come to a close, Anisha gently pulls an old elementary school photograph of Charlie out of an alter-l shrine (complete with a home-made heart with a pin throug it, a cup with musty rain water and many “lucky” items, s as a horseshoe, a rabbit’s foot, a four-leaf clover, etc. With a satisfied smile, she starts to disassemble the shr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear PARTY MUSIC as the CAMERA TRACKS into the DOLPHIN TANK EXHIBIT. As we round the corner we see hundreds of penguins waddling around in little iced cubicles, each wearing their natural black-and-white tuxedos. TILT UP to see hundreds of WEDDING GUESTS. The Dolphin Tank has been covered over with a glass dance floor so that the exquisite animals swim underneath the partying people. It’s unbelievably beautiful. The gang is all here -- and just about everybody is with someone they love. Reba with her new guy, Carol with hers Stacey, Katie, Nicole, Pleasure, Howard with Marilyn, Joe (wearing a HEMP TUX), and even Eleanor Skepple (all with their mates). We finally come upon Stu, his arm around Lara who sports modified bridesmaid dress (altered to make room for her t boob). Stu looks with adoration at his new bride, utterin what is perhaps his only truly sincere line in the film.  121 116. sTU Do you have any idea how much I love you?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (answering with a callback of Stu’s earlier line) Do bridesmaids give head in the coat room?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Do they?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Why don’t we go find out...? They make a quick exit toward the foyer, passing Cam and Charlie who are taking the floor for their “first dance”. Charlie spins Cam, who trips on her train, stumbling back She grabs a hold of Charlie to keep herself from falling only manages to take him with her as they both FALL BACKW

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE MASSIVE FOUR-TIERED BEAUTIFULLY ORNATE WEDDING C
dialogues.text: The couple clean themselves off as all the SINGLE WOMEN gather at the edge of the dance floor for the throwing of bouquet. Cam HEAVES the flowers over her shoulder. A more than abl bodied throw. We watch as the women surge back to grab th flying floral arrangement. Back... back... and... INTO THE WATER BEHIND THEM. As half the wedding party tri and SPLASHES into the WHALE TANK, Cam looks back to Charl embarrassed ("OOPS"), aS we...

dialogues.speaker: FADE BACK IN
dialogues.text: SUPER: “One Year Later”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunningly beautiful shot of Cam and Charlie enjoying t once-in-a-year sunset together in the snows of Antarctica  122 117. INT. CHARLIE AND CAM’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 122 Stu rifling through Charlie’s dresser drawer. Lara is sitting topless on the bed showing off the most perfect s of three breasts imaginable. They are mesmerizing -- as s Moves, they bounce and sway. (NOTE: these aren’t “TOTAL RECALL” cheesy-looking triple-nipples, we’re talking ILM’ finest.)

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Sex tapes. Why bother house- sitting if you can’t scope out some good old-fashioned home-made porn. Suddenly -- Ah-haiii Stu pulls out an unmarked DV tape safely tucked into an old tube sock. He puts the tape into the machine -- all smiles and press PLAY. ON THE SCREEN -- we see Cam and Charlie’s home-made sex t (SCREENWRITER’S NOTE: I don’t know if you’ve ever videota yourself having sex, but let me tell you from experience, isn’t pretty. Most home-made tapes fall into the genre of “Porn-Horror”). As the credits continue to roll, we see out-of-focus shot and incredibly embarrassing moments from Cam and Charlie’ “magical” night. The beautifully shot “movie” version was nothing close to what really happened. Some of the moment include: -- Having forgotten it was laundry day, Cam realizes (too late) that she is wearing her “Granny panties”. -- At Cam’s urging, Charlie tries to “talk nasty” but has hard time getting the hang of it (ie. “Ooo, yeah, bounce boobs like a... bouncy... hippity hop... Wait, can I star over again?”) -- “Whoah, whoah, whoah... wrong hole.” -- Charlie trying to blame the “squeaky bed” for what was unquestionably flatulence. -- While reaching for lubrication (which spills EVERYWHER and makes it difficult to hold the camera), Charlie disco Cam’s stash of a zillion sex toys.  118. -- We see some CLOSE UP FOOTAGE of Cam and Charlie having (we hear them groaning in the background) that could easi be footage of INTESTINAL SURGERY on the Discovery Channel When we CUTAWAY to see Lara and Stu watching, they look t on the verge of getting sick. -- Back on the tape, we see Charlie crying after the firs round of sex, taken with emotion. Sad and pathetic. -- Round two: Charlie tries “talking nasty” again. With even less luck. “Oh, yeah, do me like... like... a thing that you do... that you really like... when you do it. Uh huh. Do me sort of like that. Okay, I give up.” -- For the final shot, the camera is CLOSE on Charlie. It clear that Cam is on top of him and they are grinding passionately. We hear her orgasming, and as she does, she DROPS THE CAMERA -- it SMACKS CHARLIE IN THE FACE. Ouch. The image FUTZES OUT, as we go...
